intro: Sebicea klaineana, commonly known as the Klaïne's sebicea, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milky sap-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
